---
slug: /158
title: "This Week In React #158: Astro, Server Components, VisionCamera, Owner Tree, Props Drilling, Next.js, Remix, Chakra, TypeScript, Skia, Biome, CSS, Node.js..."
authors: [slorber]
date: 09-06-2023
---
Hi everyone!
We're covering 2 weeks of news, including 2 great releases: Astro 3.0 and VisionCamera 3.0. There have also been a lot of interesting articles, so I've had to filter a bit!

segments.source_content: Bun 1.0 coming out tonight. I'm curious to see what they have planned. Having tested it on unit tests as a replacement for Jest, it's really very fast.

segments.source_content: For those who want to visit Italy, go to [reactjsday](https://2023.reactjsday.it/) in Verona on 27 October 27. The conference is offering [-10% on tickets](https://ti.to/grusp/reactjsday-2023/discount/media_TWIR) and 2 online/remote tickets to our readers, which I'm giving away to the first 2 people who reply to this email and claim them.

segments.source_content: Learn React.js from the ground up to advanced topics like performance, testing, and code quality. Start by building a real-world app in the Complete Introduction to React. Continue with Intermediate React, integrating the most popular tools from the ecosystem. Then learn performance, TypeScript, and even Next.js, the fullstack React framework!

segments.source_content: ## âš›ï¸ React {#react}
[![Astro 3.0](/emails/issues/158/astro3.jpg)](https://astro.build/blog/astro-3/)
[**Astro 3.0**](https://astro.build/blog/astro-3/)

This new version of Astro innovates in particular through the use of the new View Transition API, and the ability to navigate fluidly and animatedly from one page to another, while preserving the state of the components displayed. This reduces the need for a SPA in many use cases.

translations.fr: Cette nouvelle version d'Astro innove notamment grÃ¢ce Ã  l'utilisation de la nouvelle View Transition API, permettant une navigation fluide et animÃ©e entre les pages tout en prÃ©servant l'Ã©tat des composants affichÃ©s. Cela rÃ©duit le besoin d'une SPA dans de nombreux cas d'usage.
translations.en: Cette nouvelle version d'Astro innove notamment par l'utilisation de la nouvelle API View Transition, et la capacitÃ© Ã  naviguer de maniÃ¨re fluide et animÃ©e d'une page Ã  l'autre, tout en prÃ©servant l'Ã©tat des composants affichÃ©s. Cela rÃ©duit le besoin d'une SPA dans de nombreux cas d'usage.

segments.source_content: Other notable improvements include:

- Image Optimization stable
- Faster Rendering Performance: Astro components render 30-75% faster.
- SSR Enhancements for Serverless: New ways to connect to your hosting platform.
- HMR Enhancements for JSX: Fast Refresh support for React and Preact.
- Optimized Build Output: Cleaner and more performant HTML.

translations.fr:
- Optimisation d'images stable
- Performances de rendu accrues : les composants Astro rendent 30 Ã  75% plus vite
- AmÃ©liorations SSR pour Serverless : nouvelles mÃ©thodes de connexion Ã  votre plateforme d'hÃ©bergement
- AmÃ©liorations HMR pour JSX : prise en charge de Fast Refresh pour React et Preact
- Sortie de build optimisÃ©e : HTML plus propre et performant
translations.en:
- Optimisation d'image stable
- Performances de rendu plus rapides : les composants Astro rendent 30 Ã  75 % plus vite.
- AmÃ©liorations SSR pour Serverless : De nouvelles faÃ§ons de se connecter Ã  votre plateforme d'hÃ©bergement.
- AmÃ©liorations HMR pour JSX : Prise en charge de Fast Refresh pour React et Preact.
- Sortie de build optimisÃ©e : HTML plus propre et plus performant.

segments.source_content: [![Making Sense of React Server Components](/emails/issues/158/rsc.jpg)](https://www.joshwcomeau.com/react/server-components/)
[**Making Sense of React Server Components**](https://www.joshwcomeau.com/react/server-components/)

Josh Comeau is back with a great introduction to React Server Components, taken from his [course](https://www.joyofreact.com/) that should become available next week. The many animated diagrams make it easy to understand this new React paradigm.

segments.source_content:
- ğŸ’¸ [Zero To Shipped - Master Fast-Paced Fullstack Development and **Finally** ship that product](https://www.zerotoshipped.com/)
- ğŸ¦ [Remix v2 pre-release](https://twitter.com/remix_run/status/1696525340640936190): if you have already enabled [future flags v2](https://remix.run/blog/future-flags), you should be able to upgrade easily and remove these flags.
- ğŸ¦ [Dan Abramov joins Bluesky](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1695566446007386214): Dan has left Meta and joined this Twitter competitor based on a cross-platform Expo app. I think this is great news, we may have gained a great evangelist [to promote cross-platform and Expo](https://twitter.com/dan_abramov/status/1699476986727399933).
- ğŸ¦ [WIP testing docs for Next.js App Router](https://twitter.com/leeerob/status/1698758756924825723)
- ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ“ [Next.js App Router - Forms and Mutations docs](https://nextjs.org/docs/app/building-your-application/data-fetching/forms-and-mutations): new doc page explaining the use of Server Actions and the React `useFormStatus` and `useOptimistic` hooks.
- ğŸ’¬ [Next.js Tim Neutkens' Deep Dive - Caching and Revalidating](https://github.com/vercel/next.js/discussions/54075)
- ğŸ“œ [Parents & Owners in React: Data Flow](https://julesblom.com/writing/parents-owners-data-flow): original interactive and visual article, explaining the problem of props drilling and how to avoid it with slotted components. Explains the concepts of parent tree and owner tree. The props drilling problem becomes clearly visible in the diagrams.
- ğŸ“œ [Challenging Established Norms: Making Component Fetching the Exception](https://jjenzz.com/making-component-fetching-the-exception/): an interesting thought that encourages you to run your queries at route level to avoid waterfalls, and use composition to avoid props drilling.
- ğŸ“œ [Rust Server Components](https://anto.pt/articles/rust-server-components): proposes to partially reproduce RSC, MDX and Suspense using Rust, HTMX and a few other libs. "the Rust equivalent of T3 Stack". Nice to read, even though I don't do Rust. Not convinced that the end result solves all the problems RSCs do.
- ğŸ“œ [Chakra, Panda and Ark - What's the plan?](https://www.adebayosegun.com/blog/chakra-panda-ark-whats-the-plan): Segun answers a number of questions about his libraries. Chakra v3 arrives in Q4, but will still use Emotion. The addition of "use client" makes it easier to use in RSCs. Adoption of the Radix `asChild` pattern.
- ğŸ“œ [How to Pass a Component as a Prop in React](https://www.totaltypescript.com/pass-component-as-prop-react): Matt shares some TypeScript + React typing tips. The type to implement "as" prop is quite scary ğŸ˜¬.
- ğŸ“œ [Handling type-safe toast notifications with zod in Remix applications](https://alemtuzlak.hashnode.dev/handling-toasts-in-remix): explains how to use the Remix flash session to give feedback after an action.
- ğŸ“œ [Optimizing Next.js cold starts for Vercel](https://holocron.so/blog/optimizing-next.js-cold-starts-for-vercel)
- ğŸ“œ [Strongly Typing React Props with TypeScript](https://www.totaltypescript.com/react-props-typescript)
- ğŸ“œ [You Might Not Need A useEffectAsync Hook](https://krassnig.dev/blog/you-might-not-need-a-use-effect-async-hook.html)
- ğŸ“œ [Web Developers, CSS-in-JS is Ruining Your Product](https://cord.com/blog/migrating-from-css-in-js-to-vanilla-extract)
- ğŸ“œ [Build your own headless UI components](https://www.jacobparis.com/content/react-headless-submenus)
- ğŸ“œ [Building a toast component](https://emilkowal.ski/ui/building-a-toast-component)
- ğŸ“¦ [next-flat-routes](https://github.com/ifyio/next-flat-routes)
- ğŸ“¦ [Puck - Self-hosted drag and drop editor for React](https://github.com/measuredco/puck)
- ğŸ“¦ [react-prod-sourcemaps](https://github.com/markerikson/react-prod-sourcemaps)
- ğŸ“¦ [Reshaped 2.2 - Now available on NPM](https://reshaped.so/content/blog/2.2)
- ğŸ‘¥ [reactjsday](https://2023.reactjsday.it/) (Verona ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡¹, Octobre 27, 2023) is offering us [-10% on conference tickets](https://ti.to/grusp/reactjsday-2023/discount/media_TWIR) with code "media_TWIR"

segments.source_content: If you are looking to set up a robust form management system fully integrated in your IT infrastructure that allows you to retain full control over the data flow, and you donâ€™t want to spend months and thousands of dollars to get it up and running, then SurveyJS is the way to go!

translations.fr: Si vous cherchez Ã  mettre en place un systÃ¨me robuste de gestion de formulaires entiÃ¨rement intÃ©grÃ© Ã  votre infrastructure informatique, vous permettant de conserver un contrÃ´le total sur le flux de donnÃ©es, sans passer des mois ni dÃ©penser des milliers de dollars pour le dÃ©ployer, alors SurveyJS est la solution idÃ©ale !
translations.en: Si vous cherchez Ã  mettre en place un systÃ¨me robuste de gestion de formulaires entiÃ¨rement intÃ©grÃ© Ã  votre infrastructure informatique, vous permettant de conserver le contrÃ´le total du flux de donnÃ©es, et que vous ne voulez pas passer des mois et dÃ©penser des milliers de dollars pour le mettre en place, alors SurveyJS est la solution !

segments.source_content: SurveyJS is a product suite of four open-source JavaScript libraries that allow you to create and edit multiple dynamic JSON-based forms in a drag-and-drop form builder, render them in your React app and store sensitive survey data within your in-house infrastructure. You can then render your custom surveys and forms as editable PDF files in a browser and visualize survey results with interactive charts and tables. [Learn more now](https://surveyjs.io/?utm_source=thisweekinreact&utm_medium=email).

translations.fr: SurveyJS est une suite de quatre bibliothÃ¨ques JavaScript open-source qui permettent de crÃ©er et modifier plusieurs formulaires dynamiques basÃ©s sur JSON via un constructeur par glisser-dÃ©poser, de les afficher dans votre application React et de stocker les donnÃ©es sensibles des enquÃªtes au sein de votre propre infrastructure. Vous pouvez ensuite afficher vos enquÃªtes et formulaires personnalisÃ©s sous forme de fichiers PDF modifiables dans un navigateur et visualiser les rÃ©sultats avec des graphiques et tableaux interactifs. [En savoir plus](https://surveyjs.io/?utm_source=thisweekinreact&utm_medium=email).
translations.en: SurveyJS est une suite produit de quatre bibliothÃ¨ques JavaScript open-source qui vous permettent de crÃ©er et modifier plusieurs formulaires dynamiques basÃ©s sur JSON dans un constructeur de formulaires par glisser-dÃ©poser, de les afficher dans votre application React et de stocker les donnÃ©es sensibles des enquÃªtes dans votre infrastructure interne. Vous pouvez ensuite afficher vos enquÃªtes et formulaires personnalisÃ©s sous forme de fichiers PDF modifiables dans un navigateur et visualiser les rÃ©sultats d'enquÃªte avec des graphiques et tableaux interactifs. [En savoir plus maintenant](https://surveyjs.io/?utm_source=thisweekinreact&utm_medium=email).

segments.source_content: ## ğŸ“± React-Native {#react-native}
[![VisionCamera 3.0](/emails/issues/158/visioncamera3.jpg)](https://github.com/mrousavy/react-native-vision-camera/releases/tag/v3.0.0)
[**VisionCamera 3.0**](https://github.com/mrousavy/react-native-vision-camera/releases/tag/v3.0.0)
The new version of VisionCamera has just been released. Highlights:

translations.fr: La nouvelle version de VisionCamera vient de sortir. Points forts :
translations.en: La nouvelle version de VisionCamera vient de sortir. Points forts :

segments.source_content:
- Full Android Camera2 rewrite
- Custom GPU OpenGL Video Pipeline
- New Camera Features
- New Frame Processor Engine (react-native-worklets-core)
- New Frame Processor Plugin API

segments.source_content: Marc took the decision to finally [remove the integration with Skia](https://github.com/mrousavy/react-native-vision-camera/pull/1740) to keep the code size and complexity reasonable on VisionCamera.

segments.source_content: In [**Pose Detection using VisionCamera V3, TFLite and Skia**](https://mrousavy.com/blog/VisionCamera-Pose-Detection-TFLite), he explains what is possible with such integration. The results are very impressive.

translations.fr: Dans [**DÃ©tection de poses avec VisionCamera V3, TFLite et Skia**](https://mrousavy.com/blog/VisionCamera-Pose-Detection-TFLite), il explique ce qu'il est possible de rÃ©aliser avec une telle intÃ©gration. Les rÃ©sultats sont trÃ¨s impressionnants.
